q: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
h:
“Be polite to all, but intimate with few.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
h:
“Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.” —
Aristotle

q: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.
h:
“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: May you live all the days of your life.
h:
“May you live all the days of your life.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: A leader leads by example, not by force.
h:
“A leader leads by example, not by force.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.
h:
“Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.” —
Og Mandino

q: Change is never easy, but always possible.
h:
“Change is never easy, but always possible.” —
Barack Obama

q: Don't hate the player. Change the game.
h:
“Don't hate the player. Change the game.” —
Steve Harvey

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
h:
“We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
h:
“Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.” —
Helen Keller

q: There is a cosmic law which says that every satisfaction must be paid for with a dissatisfaction.
h:
“There is a cosmic law which says that every satisfaction must be paid for with a dissatisfaction.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
h:
“What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?” —
George Eliot

q: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
h:
“It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.
h:
“The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
h:
“Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.” —
Huang Po

q: You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.
h:
“You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: You are what you believe yourself to be.
h:
“You are what you believe yourself to be.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.
h:
“Don't allow your mind to tell your heart what to do. The mind gives up easily.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: You play the hand you're dealt. I think the game's worthwhile.
h:
“You play the hand you're dealt. I think the game's worthwhile. ” —
Christopher Reeve

q: What people need and what they want may be very different.
h:
“What people need and what they want may be very different.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Unless you're ashamed of yourself now and then, you're not honest.
h:
“Unless you're ashamed of yourself now and then, you're not honest.” —
William Faulkner

q: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
h:
“The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.” —
Aristotle

q: Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.
h:
“Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
h:
“The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: There is no significance in life without struggle.
h:
“There is no significance in life without struggle.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.
h:
“You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.” —
Unknown

q: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
h:
“Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Not everything that weighs you down is yours to carry.
h:
“Not everything that weighs you down is yours to carry.” —
Unknown

q: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
h:
“The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: The mind is the limit.
h:
“The mind is the limit.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
h:
“Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude. ” —
Ralph Marston

q: There is nothing quite so tragic as a young cynic.
h:
“There is nothing quite so tragic as a young cynic.” —
Maya Angelou

q: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
h:
“As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
h:
“We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
h:
“Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.
h:
“It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.” —
Tony Robbins

q: When asked, how do you write? I invariably answer, one word at a time.
h:
“When asked, how do you write? I invariably answer, one word at a time.” —
Stephen King

q: A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.
h:
“A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.” —
Dogen

q: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
h:
“It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.” —
Will Rogers

q: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
h:
“The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively.
h:
“Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively.” —
Dalai Lama

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.
h:
“When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.
h:
“Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.
h:
“Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: To earn more you must learn more.
h:
“To earn more you must learn more.” —
Brian Tracy

q: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
h:
“It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.
h:
“Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
h:
“Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.” —
Herodotus
